page.title: 19Birds and Wild Flowers.
page.content: Near{Plenmeller}you can see red grouse, pheasants, partridges and other game birds. Curlews, lapwings, plover, snipe, carrion crows, black headed gulls, jackdaws, kestrels, sparrow hawks, skylarks, meadow pippits, and field fares in winter are seen on the{moor.} Swifts, swallows and sand martins feed near the{river. On the{Lake}there are coots, moorhens and mallard ducks. Pied wagtails, oyster catchers and dippers live near the{South Tyne. Between the{bypass and the river}we found dandelions, daisies, buttercups, clover, dogrose, hedge parsley, yarrow, plantain, speedwell, foxgloves and thistle. Down{by the river,}we found willow herb, wild violets and thrift (or seapink). On the{fell}we found gorse, broom, bramble, heather, cotton grass, harebells and tormentil.
